channel.title: Brandon Boswell

item.title: Specialist
item.description: We recently had a network technician from Verizon work on our FiOS connection. They have machines that can detect refraction ( OTDR) in Fiber Optic lines and pinpoint where it is down to the foot.
item.content:encoded: We recently had a network technician from Verizon work on our FiOS connection. They have machines that can detect refraction ( OTDR) in Fiber Optic lines and pinpoint where it is down to the foot. This is the reason to specialize. Get your Ph D. and become the best at that.

item.title: Sleep on a project
item.description: I really believe in sleep and the process of I think when you sleep, your brain figures out the problems you had the morning before, so I mean, I will always sleep on a manuscript, and often the problem I have you know, one day after a good night’s sleep, it gets fixed the next day.
item.content:encoded: I really believe in sleep and the process of I think when you sleep, your brain figures out the problems you had the morning before, so I mean, I will always sleep on a manuscript, and often the problem I have you know, one day after a good night’s sleep, it gets fixed the next day. — Austin Kleon

item.title: Staccato Method
item.description: A term I coined on 2022-11-21 for the success I have observed in design when using smaller chunks of work over longer periods of time. Instead of brute forcing a project over a single session or two, work on aspects of it over a handful of smaller work sessions across a few days.
item.content:encoded:
A term I coined on 2022-11-21 for the success I have observed in design when using smaller chunks of work over longer periods of time. Instead of brute forcing a project over a single session or two, work on aspects of it over a handful of smaller work sessions across a few days. This enables you to have multiple fresh looks at the project (and your work on it), and I find that it leads to better overall quality.

I find in design, you can no longer see your work clearly after spending too much time with it. You need to leave it, do something else and re-evaluate it with “fresh eyes”.

Sleep on a project

item.title: Opinionated Products
item.description: My favorite products are opinionated. They make a clear statement about what they are not good at, in favor of being much better at something else. — Stephan Ango
item.content:encoded:
My favorite products are opinionated. They make a clear statement about what they are not good at, in favor of being much better at something else. — Stephan Ango

Product Design

For example, Dorsata is about decision support and not forgetting things, it is willing to trade minor amounts of documentation speed in order to achieve that.

item.title: Wunderkammer
item.description: “Cabinet of Curiosities” This was a thing back in the 16th century. Now in the digital age this is largely going away, but it is something we have decided to embrace.
item.content:encoded:
“Cabinet of Curiosities”

This was a thing back in the 16th century. Now in the digital age this is largely going away, but it is something we have decided to embrace. In our case, it is our Burrow Bookshelf in the Living Room.

item.title: Be near people doing the things you want to do
item.description: Be where things are happening. I think this is the biggest argument for why you should live in or near a big city. This was a major factor in the second dot com boom in San Francisco, CA.
item.content:encoded:
Be where things are happening. I think this is the biggest argument for why you should live in or near a big city. This was a major factor in the second dot com boom in San Francisco, CA.

“Serendipity happens, if you let it.”

Make yourself go out and meet people

This also works on the internet by being vocal and engaging with others.

item.title: Building a Discord Community
item.description: Establish a Welcome Channel With an FAQ Set a channel for some basic rules Additional Rules Resource Create a list of engaging channels Welcome / Intros e-Ink Productivity Off-Topic Voice Huddles Consider emojis…
item.content:encoded:
• Establish a Welcome Channel

    • With an FAQ

  • Set a channel for some basic rules

    • Additional Rules Resource

  • Create a list of engaging channels

    • Welcome / Intros
    • e-Ink
    • Productivity
    • Off-Topic
    • Voice Huddles

  • Consider emojis…

  • Consider giving people tags based on their profession

    • Student
    • Academic
    • Engineer
    • Designer
    • Lawyer

  • Give active member roles

  • Do some form of a launch event to get things started

    • What would be a good event to bring people in?
    • Maybe the Kindle Scribe unboxing?
    • Could also livestream that on YouTube.

  • Figure out how we will make sure people know that it exists

    • Twitter?
      • Maybe try to get some people I know to share it
    • Reddit
      • e-Ink
      • Productivity?
    • YouTube channel update
    • At the end of videos
    • Have current members invite others
      • Who should be here, but isn’t?
      • Should it be anyone is let in, or should it be more “Knowledgeable People” and invite only.

  • Goals

    • Why are you building an online community? What will your members get by being in it? What can you offer them as value? What will you get out of it as the creator?
    • At the beginning of any online community, it’s important to do a deep dive into what you want it to accomplish.
    • Connect with subscribers
    • Give a place to have deeper conversation
    • Connect smart people with one another
      • Let them talk amongst themselves
    • Share updates

item.title: SHORT— Favorite tip for getting into Flowstate — Set an Alarm
YouTube Thumbnails that catch my eye
item.description: moc/YouTube 7M Subs Just used the high quality are from the game. Probably wouldn’t work for me 2K Subs Logo is front and center Colorful Arrow lead your eye
item.content:encoded:
moc/YouTube

7M Subs Just used the high quality are from the game. Probably wouldn’t work for me

2K Subs Logo is front and center Colorful Arrow lead your eye

3.5M Subs Clean Beautiful color grade Device is front and center Device is unique and recognizable Background blur is beautiful Targeting a knowledge worker based on the desk setup

711K Subs Cool use of color and typography 3.5M Subs Great color grade Beautiful Text

313K Subs Big Text Great contrast between the text and the white background

4.4K Subs Beautiful Color Simple Shot Clear Text Nice subtle gradientv

58K Subs Great text style again Creating a scene with other items around

193K Subs Host first Icons are useful. Overall only okay

13K Subs I like that this one has bright colors and lets you showcase an app window easily

1M Subs I really like the color work here

item.title: Sound for YouTube
item.description: Epidemic Sound — $9 per month for YouTube channels I haven’t used it, but assuming you could use it month to month then it would be a decent deal.
item.content:encoded:

  • I haven’t used it, but assuming you could use it month to month then it would be a decent deal.
